repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

body:
- Adds all the new [bit manipulation functions](https://en.cppreference.com/w/cpp/header/bit) inside the `<Bit>` header library coming with C++20.
- Adds a new `cpp20` tag for the tests.

comment_data.body: It's often helpful to name arguments in order to support keyword argument calls. Here, users might want to pass the rotation bit count as keyword args (why not).
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+cdef extern from "<bit>" namespace "std" nogil:
+    # bit_cast (gcc >= 11.0, clang >= 14.0)
+    cdef To bit_cast[To, From](From&)
+
+    # byteswap (C++23)
+    #cdef T byteswap[T](T)
+
+    # integral powers of 2 (gcc >= 10.0, clang >= 12.0)
+    cdef bint has_single_bit[T](T)
+    cdef T bit_ceil[T](T)
+    cdef T bit_floor[T](T)
+    cdef int bit_width[T](T)
+
+    # rotating (gcc >= 9.0, clang >= 9.0)
+    cdef T rotl[T](T, int)
+    cdef T rotr[T](T, int)

comment_data.body: I think we have enough copies of this function by now to merit a configurable version, i.e. have one function, pass in all relevant compiler versions, and let it return a closure function that configures the extension build. Then call the outer function three times in `EXT_EXTRAS`, for C++11/17/20, and then some more in the future.

```suggestion
    cdef T rotl[T](T, int shift)
    cdef T rotr[T](T, int shift)
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,31 @@
+cdef extern from "<bit>" namespace "std" nogil:
+    # bit_cast (gcc >= 11.0, clang >= 14.0)
+    cdef To bit_cast[To, From](From&)
+
+    # byteswap (C++23)
+    #cdef T byteswap[T](T)
+
+    # integral powers of 2 (gcc >= 10.0, clang >= 12.0)
+    cdef bint has_single_bit[T](T)
+    cdef T bit_ceil[T](T)
+    cdef T bit_floor[T](T)
+    cdef int bit_width[T](T)
+
+    # rotating (gcc >= 9.0, clang >= 9.0)
+    cdef T rotl[T](T, int)
+    cdef T rotr[T](T, int)

commit.message: Apple Clang doesn't support all of C++20's bit manipulation functions

commit.message: Give a name to the shift arguments to allow their usage as kwargs.

repo.description: The most widely used Python to C compiler
repo.name: cython

milestone.description:
Goals:
– New version scheme: 3.x instead of 0.x.
– Change default `language_level` from `2` to `3str`.
– Change default for `binding` directive from `False` to `True`.
– Fix some Python compatibility issues (if possible, allowing for breaking changes).

title: Add C++20's Bit manipulation functions
